intro: Gurania sararensis, commonly known as the Sararensis Gurania, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas with cool climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
